result.reason: The original 2018 report predates the InitializeAsync refactor which replaced DoEvents() with await Task.Delay() — need confirmation whether this still occurs on current builds before investing in a fix.
result.approach: Verify if InitializeAsync code path (which avoids DoEvents) is always used; if bug still occurs, consider removing synchronous InitializeActiveXControl entirely and setting GrabFocusOnConnect=false during initialization
